trans-unit.source: Get Started with Mobile Services for Xamarin.Android
trans-unit.target: Get Started with Mobile Services for Xamarin.Android

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services with your Xamarin.Android app.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Azure Mobile Services with your Xamarin.Android app.

trans-unit.source: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Xamarin.Android app using Azure Mobile Services. In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple
trans-unit.target: This tutorial shows you how to add a cloud-based backend service to a Xamarin.Android app using Azure Mobile Services. In this tutorial, you will create both a new mobile service and a simple

trans-unit.source: To do list
trans-unit.target: To do list

trans-unit.source: app that stores app data in the new mobile service.
trans-unit.target: app that stores app data in the new mobile service.

trans-unit.source: A screenshot from the completed app is below:
trans-unit.target: A screenshot from the completed app is below:

trans-unit.source: watch the tutorial
trans-unit.target: watch the tutorial

trans-unit.source: Play Video
trans-unit.target: Play Video

trans-unit.source: Completing this tutorial requires [Xamarin.Android], which installs Xamarin Studio and a Visual Studio plug-in (on Windows) as well as the latest Android platform.
trans-unit.target: Completing this tutorial requires [Xamarin.Android], which installs Xamarin Studio and a Visual Studio plug-in (on Windows) as well as the latest Android platform.

trans-unit.source: Android 4.2 SDK or a later version is required.
trans-unit.target: Android 4.2 SDK or a later version is required.

trans-unit.source: The downloaded quickstart project contains the Azure Mobile services component for Xamarin.Android.
trans-unit.target: The downloaded quickstart project contains the Azure Mobile services component for Xamarin.Android.

trans-unit.source: While this project targets Android 4.2 or a later version, the Mobile Services SDK requires only Android 2.2 or a later version.
trans-unit.target: While this project targets Android 4.2 or a later version, the Mobile Services SDK requires only Android 2.2 or a later version.

trans-unit.source: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.
trans-unit.target: To complete this tutorial, you need an Azure account.

trans-unit.source: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.
trans-unit.target: If you don't have an account, you can sign up for an Azure trial and get up to 10 free mobile services that you can keep using even after your trial ends.

trans-unit.source: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mcid=A9C9624B5"%20target="blank).
trans-unit.target: For details, see [Azure Free Trial](http://azure.microsoft.com/pricing/free-trial/?WT.mcid=A9C9624B5"%20target="blank).

trans-unit.source: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Management Portal to either create a new app or modify an existing app to connect to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: Once you have created your mobile service, you can follow an easy quickstart in the Management Portal to either create a new app or modify an existing app to connect to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In this section you will create a new Xamarin.Android app that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: In this section you will create a new Xamarin.Android app that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.
trans-unit.target: In the Management Portal, click Mobile Services, and then click the mobile service that you just created.

trans-unit.source: In the quickstart tab, click Xamarin.Android under Choose platform and expand Create a new Android app.
trans-unit.target: In the quickstart tab, click Xamarin.Android under Choose platform and expand Create a new Android app.

trans-unit.source: This displays the three easy steps to create a Xamarin.Android app connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This displays the three easy steps to create a Xamarin.Android app connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Click Create TodoItem table to create a table to store app data.
trans-unit.target: Click Create TodoItem table to create a table to store app data.

trans-unit.source: Under Download and run app, click Download.
trans-unit.target: Under Download and run app, click Download.

trans-unit.source: This downloads the project for the sample To do list application that is connected to your mobile service.
trans-unit.target: This downloads the project for the sample To do list application that is connected to your mobile service.

trans-unit.source: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.
trans-unit.target: Save the compressed project file to your local computer, and make a note of where you save it.

trans-unit.source: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.
trans-unit.target: The final stage of this tutorial is to build and run your new app.

trans-unit.source: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files and expand the files on your computer.
trans-unit.target: Browse to the location where you saved the compressed project files and expand the files on your computer.

trans-unit.source: In Xamarin Studio or Visual Studio, click File then Open, navigate to the uncompressed sample files, and select XamarinTodoQuickStart.Android.sln to open it.
trans-unit.target: In Xamarin Studio or Visual Studio, click File then Open, navigate to the uncompressed sample files, and select XamarinTodoQuickStart.Android.sln to open it.

trans-unit.source: Press the Run button to build the project and start the app.
trans-unit.target: Press the Run button to build the project and start the app.

trans-unit.source: You will be asked to select an emulator or a connected USB device.
trans-unit.target: You will be asked to select an emulator or a connected USB device.

trans-unit.source: To be able to run the project in the Android emulator, you must define a least one Android Virtual Device (AVD).
trans-unit.target: To be able to run the project in the Android emulator, you must define a least one Android Virtual Device (AVD).

trans-unit.source: Use the AVD Manager to create and manage these devices.
trans-unit.target: Use the AVD Manager to create and manage these devices.

trans-unit.source: In the app, type meaningful text, such as Complete the tutorial, and then click Add.
trans-unit.target: In the app, type meaningful text, such as Complete the tutorial, and then click Add.

trans-unit.source: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.
trans-unit.target: This sends a POST request to the new mobile service hosted in Azure.

trans-unit.source: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.
trans-unit.target: Data from the request is inserted into the TodoItem table.

trans-unit.source: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the list.
trans-unit.target: Items stored in the table are returned by the mobile service, and the data is displayed in the list.

trans-unit.source: You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file.
trans-unit.target: You can review the code that accesses your mobile service to query and insert data, which is found in the ToDoActivity.cs C# file.

trans-unit.source: Back in the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItems table.
trans-unit.target: Back in the Management Portal, click the Data tab and then click the TodoItems table.

trans-unit.source: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.
trans-unit.target: This lets you browse the data inserted by the app into the table.

trans-unit.source: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:
trans-unit.target: Now that you have completed the quickstart, learn how to perform additional important tasks in Mobile Services:

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with offline data sync]
Learn how the quickstart uses offline data sync to make the app responsive and robust.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with offline data sync]
Learn how the quickstart uses offline data sync to make the app responsive and robust.

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with authentication]
Learn how to authenticate users of your app with an identity provider.

trans-unit.source:
[Get started with push notifications]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
trans-unit.target:
[Get started with push notifications]
Learn how to send a very basic push notification to your app.
